page.title: 08The Parsonage Museum
page.content: The{Rev.Patrick Bronte}was vicar of {Haworth}from{1820-1861.}The novels of his daughters,{Charlotte,Emily and {Anne}use local settings and dialect, particularly Emily's{"Wuthering {Heights".}The parsonage where they lived was given to the{Bronte Society in{1928}by a local business man,{Sir {James Roberts,}to be a permanent memorial to the Brontes.It has been made to resemble the original as closely as possible,despite alterations carried out by the Rev. Bronte's successors.To a large extent the original furniture has been recovered.It has a large collection of books and materials,used by scholars world-wide. The{Bronte Society}has 2000 members and is a highly successful,privately run organisation able to maintain running costs unsubsidised.The
